p.s: In his speech, given on 1 November 2021 at the COP26 World Leaders' Summit Opening Ceremony the British Prime Minister Boris Johnson explains the importance of this agreement in order to fight against the climate change.
His idea of the climate crisis is that it is man-made and that we ignore it even though scientists warn us.

Boris Johnson also sees the responsibility the conclave of world leaders have towards young people and the posterity, because the climate crisis with its speed and aburptnessabruptness will not stoppstop.
The British Prime Minister points out the huge role of the COP26 for this crisis.
In comparison to other agreements Glasgow needs to take action.
He claims that they have the technology, the ideas and the opportunity to get finances to change things.
But they only will have the finances and the opportunities to change something if all countries work together and help each other.
All in all Boris Johnson reminds the members of the COP26 of their responsibility to achieve something against climate change and stresses out which impact this crisis already has on the world.
